intro: Stemonurus flavicarpus, commonly known as the yellow-fruited stemonurus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and yellowish fruits that develop from its flowering structures. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
